TECHNIQUE.name: SSH authorised keys
TECHNIQUE.DESCRIPTION: This technique will check if the required SSH keys are present on a user directory. Supported key formats are ssh-rsa|ssh-dss|ssh-ed25519|ecdsa-sha2-nistp521|ecdsa-sha2-nistp384|ecdsa-sha2-nistp256|ssh-dsa.

INPUT.NAME: SSH_KEY_DISTRIBUTION_TAG
INPUT.LONGDESCRIPTION: Enter a tag to track this key in reports, i.e. "root #1" or "Operations key". It will not be used in the authorized_keys file.

INPUT.NAME: SSH_KEY_DISTRIBUTION_NAME
INPUT.LONGDESCRIPTION: User to apply the key to

INPUT.NAME: SSH_KEY_DISTRIBUTION_KEY
INPUT.LONGDESCRIPTION: Full content of the key to insert in authorized_keys format, may include comments.

SELECT1.NAME: SSH_KEY_DISTRIBUTION_EDIT_TYPE
SELECT1.LONGDESCRIPTION: Flush the authorized keys file - only keys managed by Rudder will remain in this file. If any key for a user has this parameter set, and is not in audit mode, then all keys non managed by Rudder for this user will be purged. Also, if any keys checked in audit mode is non compliant for a given user, the keys won't be purged.
